name: places/ChIJW9HakQb0wokR4TIQVA2M4OE
formattedAddress: 105 Arden St # 1b, New York, NY 10040, USA
adrFormatAddress: 105 Arden St # 1b, New York, NY 10040, USA

originalText.text: Very disappointed in this office. My first experience was negative as I showed up on the morning of my appointment and no one was in the office. They later told me that all the staff were running late but no one called me at the time to let me know. My second visit was just as bad because I was waiting in the waiting room for an hour to be called to speak to the doctor. Workflow should not be like this. Will be finding a new doctor.

originalText.text: Wonderful Doctor and staff, i have no complains at all. DR. Pereira is one of the best primary and pediatrician doctors in the area. His staff is amazing, Ms. Rosa is a great receptionist, very friendly, she cares for patients and very kind.

text.text: Wonderful Doctor and staff, i have no complains at all. DR. Pereira is one of the best primary and pediatrician doctors in the area. His staff is amazing, Ms. Rosa is a great receptionist, very friendly, she cares for patients and very kind.

originalText.text:
I have been a patient here for over 17 years, and the way that they treat me now is horrible. If i could give this place 0 stars, i would. Now that I’m older and make my appointments myself, they do not respect me and talk to me with the most disgusting attitude. Dr. Pereira’s wife, Elizabeth, also works in the office and has the nastiest attitude of them all. She is the reason why i am changing doctors because i cannot stand being disrespected. Also, i have vitiligo and they have called my condition “Michael Jackson disease.”

Horrible location and i do not recommend.

originalText.text: The only reason I’m giving this 3 stars is because of Dr. Perreira who has been my family’s doctor since I was about 5 years old and he’s amazing at what he does along with his wife.....Other than that, I would’ve have given it a 1 star.  He employed another doctor who’s name is Safhire. She’s negligent. I ended up seeing her because Dr. Perreira was fully booked for a whole month and needed to get a checkup quick since I assumed I had an infection in which I did. Wasn’t sure what type of infection it was but she told me she was going to call me to assure me and give me further details on what it actually is after about a week after running blood tests and other additional tests. I never received a call. The moment I stepped into her working area she also almost mixed up my blood tests with an elderly patience’s blood tests because she didn’t write my name down. Dr. perreira ended up telling her that she HAS to write the names that corresponds to the blood tests or they’ll get mixed up. I love Dr.Perreira but she’s awful. I also called the office about the situation and she never called me back.  So I basically had an infection and don’t know anything about it. At this point we cannot trust this doctor to be a DOCTOR and she has an attitude problem.

originalText.text:
First time at this place to see Dr. Safhire,
The wait took over an hour and the place looking like the 1970s.. Place felt like I was there to see a witch doctor. No one looked professional at all. The area is seriously drug infested, especially out front of this office, not safe for seniors or children. A disorganized office means this organized staff.   Beware...outdated all over including the equipment from the 1970s. The only thing nice I found about this place was the beautiful professional receptionist besides that this visit was definitely a horror show.
